meanings.definition: The quality or state of being sanctimonious.
meanings.sent1: Her sanctimonies were evident in her insincere prayers.
meanings.sent2: The politician's sanctimonies were exposed when his true intentions were revealed.
meanings.sent3: The sanctimonies of the self-proclaimed saint were so transparent that even the children could see through them.
meanings.sent4: His sanctimonies were like a thin veil, easily pierced by the truth.
meanings.sent5: The sanctimonies of the preacher echoed hollow in the empty church.

meanings.sent1: The sanctimonies of the fraudster were a facade to deceive the trusting victims.
meanings.sent2: She saw through his sanctimonies and refused to be swayed by his false piety.
meanings.sent3: His sanctimonies were as convincing as a wolf in sheep's clothing.
meanings.sent4: The sanctimonies of the con artist were like a mask hiding his true intentions.
meanings.sent5: The sanctimonies of the charlatan were as shallow as a puddle in the desert.
